I see this shit on the front page every day. The game is honestly a mess right now because its just too much. Tanks defensively are inflated to all hell, So ADCs are inflated to all hell to deal with them, causing assassins to need to do millions of damage to kill them, but then ADCs arent killing tanks so supports get inflated to keep the adc alive. No 1 group is responsible.

They said that Runes were gonna be the largest patch to league to change the future. I think Riot should own up to this by making the 2nd largest patch in the history of league be midseason and just try to fix the entire mess that has happened recently.

-------------------------

Edit: When I posted this yesterday I didnt expect to wake up to it being the top post. And staying as such all day. Ill take this moment to just say that this isnt a "fuck Riot" or "fuck __" post. Just simply put in my opinion everything in the game feels a bit much right now. However the main point of this post is mainly to try to get through to people that any one group isnt more/less broken than the next. Just that the game as a whole feels a bit much. I enjoy the game, I think Riot does a good job. This isnt meant to fill an agenda, or to insert your own agenda like ive seen a little of. Nonetheless I enjoy the actual debate going on and applaud the comments discussing game balancing with a minimal amount of REEEing.

> No 1 group is responsible.

Is probably the truest statements with regards to balance I've seen on the boards. 

I've said it in another thread, every item needs a stat squish. Reduce AD across the board, reduce health across the board, CDR doesn't need to be on every item. Rework crit for the love of all that is holy, like Riot said they were going to do (or at least look at) seasons ago. Leave resistances alone IMHO, they got shafted in favour of more health.

Then Riot has something tangible to work with, and can consider adding more items to counteract the meta without worrying about everyone that isn't a tank getting one shot bursted by everyone that isn't a tank. Class updates dropped a nuclear bomb on balance, then the runes update was a natural disaster following suit, so time to start rebuilding from ground zero. 

Until Riot admits to themselves that there isn't any balance, and they need to do some drastic changes, I'm afraid it's only going to get worse. But even then, I don't doubt things will get worse before they get better.

Riot doesn't want people to be able to solo carry, that's their entire pitch the last two years. They want this to be a team game, that was the purpose of Dynamic Queue, the purpose of showing club tags in the game screen, the purpose of getting boxes when your premade gets an S, they want everyone to be playing together and coordinating as a team.

Good argument. But, to fix the problem, where does one start?

My suggestion would be to start at the ADC issue (this comes from an ADC player, mind you):

- Nerf Statikk Shiv in particular (that item accounts for a lot of ADC burstiness) and Zeal Upgrades cost in general (2900 gold or so)
- Infinity Edge to 3800 gold (and possibly 75 AD), or 4000 gold and 75-80 AD, **and**
- Retool Cloak of Agility: Builds from BF Sword + Brawler's Glove, total 2000 gold, 45-50 AD & 20% Crit Chance; an intermediate powerspike item for crit ADCs to not go all the way back to "ADC in 2k17 lul". Builds into Essence Reaver and Infinity Edge.
- Lord Dominik's and Mortal Reminder go back to 45% bonus Armor Penetration to better deal with tanks from the ADC side **and**
- New effect for Black Cleaver: Unique passive - Last Whisper: Gain 10-15% bonus Armor Penetration against targets with 6 stacks of the Cleaver debuff (to allow sustained damage fighters, Cleaver's intended users, to better deal with tanks, without making the item overbearing if stacked with Last Whisper on the same user)
- An intermediate item from Pickaxe and Vampiric Sceptre to build into Bloodthirster (+ BF Sword), Death's Dance (+ Warhammer) and Ravenous Hydra (+ Tiamat). Again, an intermediate power consolidation item on the respective build paths to allow smoothened power progression and the ability to sit on a mid-tier item. All three of these items suffer from their 3-component build paths unless they are built first item with lots of open item slots. This would help both ADCs (BT and DD) and fighters (RH and DD).

Riot's change in philosophy with the introduction of the assassin class (back around 2014), which introduced their new core rock-paper-scissors design, that being Marksmen > Tank > Assassin > Marksmen (all other roles seem to come as an after thought), ended up creating an arms race, because that's not the natural roles of those classes.
Under the assumption that each class gets to utilize their tools more than a single time in a fight, because realistically this traces back to riot trying to redesign their game to accommodate fights which only last for a single rotation of abilities. 

But once you stop making every fight last < 5 seconds, that whole rock-paper-scissors is backwards. 

Tanks, which have a lot of defensive tools which have gaps, that assassins with their superior mobility and burst, are intended to take advantage. 
Assassins, are suppose to be inherently further away from marksmen making them a much harder target to approach and burst, and in the instance that they fail to burst, they've exhausted most of their mobility and damage, only to be a sitting duck for the continuous damage of a marksmen.
Marksmen are intended to lose to tanks in an extended fight, because after maybe 3 rotations of their primary abilities, they've substantially cut down on the damage from the marksmen. Yet in doing so, this creates openings for assassins (Which are much closer to the front line) to time their damage and split through the armor of the tanks.

It's because this game's concept is a simplified moba. Instead of having creative, unique item building, compositions & skill point distribution, we have:

Armor to counter AD
Resistance to counter AP
AD? - build AD
AP? - build AP
Meta-sheep lanes and socially-designated or assigned roles.


There's less you can do to mitigate a poor lane match-up. You can't optimize to build around your counter often, you can't abuse AI in order to shift map pressure, you just have to sit there and take it in the ass. This problem is further emphasized by a lack of willingness to change one's playstyle to be more adaptable in general.

I've never tried to cooperate more as a team than back when I was playing Captain's Mode on Dota 2. The picks/bans were alternated in a balanced manner and had separate pick/ban stages (I'm not sure why this isn't a promoted mode).

Basically Lol's champ select mode is "pray for the best". Everybody gets to ban ASAP and by doing that, you hope you're not going against an OP champion, or one that will counter your lane. Whereas in a mode like CM, the captains have the option to 'fake' compositions or shut the other team down from fully actualizing their comp.

Then upon pick/ban stages being completed, teammates have the option of... **diversifying their lanes.** Maybe we'll put two top. Maybe two mid. Maybe 3 bot. The way to play is less rigid, more adaptable & consequentially, more fun and balanced. It has less to do with being restricted by picks/counters and gives more leeway to skill-based matchups because of creativity & opportunity.
